com.nus.cool.core.util

Class IntegerUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.nus.cool.core.util.IntegerUtil

  • public class IntegerUtil
extends java.lang.Object
    IntegerUtil contains a set of common functions for interger. IntegerUtil could be used to find the minimum number of bits of the interger, to find the minimum number of bytes of the interger and to convert the interger into OS's native byte order

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      IntegerUtil() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static int minBits(int i)
      Find the minimum number of bits to represent the integer.
      static int minBytes(int i)
      Find the minimum number of bytes to represent the integer.
      static int numOfBits(int i)
      Get number of bits to store, due to BitSet store as long array, so the number of bits should be multiple of 64 bits.
      static int toNativeByteOrder(int i)
      Convert the input value into BIG_ENDIAN byte order.

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • minBits

        public static int minBits(int i)
        Find the minimum number of bits to represent the integer.
        Parameters:
        i - the integer
        Returns:
        the number of bits

      • minBytes

        public static int minBytes(int i)
        Find the minimum number of bytes to represent the integer. Notes: the number of bytes can be 1, 2, 4 correspond to Byte, Short, Int
        Parameters:
        i - the integer
        Returns:
        the number of bytes

      • numOfBits

        public static int numOfBits(int i)
        Get number of bits to store, due to BitSet store as long array, so the number of bits should be multiple of 64 bits.
        Parameters:
        i - the integer
        Returns:
        number of bits

      • toNativeByteOrder

        public static int toNativeByteOrder(int i)
        Convert the input value into BIG_ENDIAN byte order. The current platform only support read/write with BIG_ENDIAN order
        Parameters:
        i - the integer
        Returns:
        the @param i in native order
